customerID.description: Unique customer identifier assigned after contract signature

scopes.bills:write: Allow to create bills and manage lifecycle

scopes.ade: Allow to interact with Agenzia delle Entrate services
scopes.accounts:write: Allow to mediate accounts creation and open banking consent renewal
scopes.invoices:write: Allow to create invoices and manage lifecycle
scopes.bills:write: Allow to create bills and manage lifecycle
scopes.constructions:read: Allow to read information about construction sites
scopes.constructions:write: Allow to create construction sites and manage the lifecycle

scopes.pagopa:write: Allow to create PagoPA payment notices

city.description: Name of the city where the property is located.

street.description: This field contains the name of the street where the property is located. It must include the name with a type (e.g., Avenue, Street, Road, etc.) but not the number or any other information.

number.description: This field refers to the numeric or alphanumeric value assigned to a property on a street.

unitNumber.description: his field is used when a single property has multiple units, such as apartments or office suites. It differentiates one unit from another within the same property.

postalCode.description: Also known as ZIP code (or CAP in Italy)

province.description: It refers to the name of the state or province where the property is located.

country.description: The name of the country where the property is located.

items.description: Countries where the bank operates in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format

futurePayments.description: True if the bank supports future payments

sct.description: List of SCT payment types supported by the bank

recurringPayments.description: List of recurring payment types supported by the bank

owner.description: Identifier of the owner of the bank account

items.description: Currencies supported by the bank account

owners.description: List of owners of the bank account

items.description: Name of the owner of the bank account

allowWireTranfersAggregation.description: Indicate if the wire transfers to the same beneficiary can be aggregated

documents.description: Dictionary of documents related to the bulk. Keys are the document type, values are the fingerprints of the documents.

code.description: Unique identifier of the checkout session. This code is secret and should never be shared with anyone who is not the payer.

collectionMethods.description:
Collection methods enabled for the payment.
Note that collection methods are the intersection of the collection methods techologies enabled for the creditor and the collection methods allowed by the client for checkout.

payments.description: List of payments related to the checkout

ConsentStatusEnum.description:
Status of the account information service (AIS) consent granted by account owner to FlowPay.
- `not_granted`: owner has never granted a consent
- `granted`: consent granted by account owner
- `revoked`: consent revoked by account owner
- `expired`: consent expired
- `all`: all types of consent

CollectionMethodEnum.description:
Collection method enabled for the payment.
- `sct`: SEPA Credit Transfer (SCT)
- `sct-inst`: SEPA Credit Transfer Instant (SCT-INST)
- `sdd`: SEPA Direct Debit (SDD)
- `card`: Credit Card
- `custom/label`: Custom collection method, enabled by the client who created the checkout. Please see the `custom` section for more details: https://docs.flowpay.it/docs/custom-collection-method

CompanyVATNumber.description: VAT number of the company, full european format

id.description: Unique identifier of the construction progress

createdAt.description: Date and time of the construction progress creation

amount.description: Total amount of the construction progress

expense.description: Fingerprint of the document accounting for the total costs for the site owner

invoices.description: Array of invoices related to each supplier for the worker. Keys are the creditor identifiers.

id.description: Unique identifier of the construction site

initialCreditFingerprint.description: Fingerprint of the initial credit document, used to transfer money to the wallet

ConsumerNationalID.description: National ID of the consumer, currently only italian format is supported

fullName.description: Full name of the contact, contains the concatenation of the name and surname of a consumer, or the name of a company.

fullVat.description: VAT number of the company in full european format or national ID of the consumer

targetFingerprint.description: Fingerprint of the document the fee is related to

targetType.description: Type of the document the fee is related to

ruleID.description: Identifier of the rule that generated the fee

linkedFingerprint.description: Fingerprint of the document the fee is linked to. Can be related to a `bulk` if the payer is the debtor of the target or to a `chain` if the payer is the creditor of the target.

id.description: Unique identifier of the fee rule

clientID.description: Unique identifier of the client that created the rule

method.description: Payment method the rule applies to

lowerBound.description: Lower bound of the rule. If the amount is lower than this value, the rule does not apply.

kind.description:
Calculation method of the fee.
- `fixed`: the fee is a fixed amount
- `percentage`: the fee is a percentage of the target's amount

numeric.description: Value of the fee. If the kind is `percentage`, the value is a percentage of the target's amount and can assume values between 0 and 1.

remittance.description: Remittance information of the fee charged to the payer

payer.description:
Payer of the fee.
- `debtor`: the debtor of the target document pays the fee using a bulk
- `creditor`: the creditor of the target document pays the fee using a chain

type.description:
Invoice relations with the debtor.
- `b2b`: invoice issued to a business
- `b2c`: invoice issued to a private person.
Note:. Invoice relations with Public Administrations are not directly supported by FlowPay. However, you can use the `b2b` type to represent the invoice issued to a Public Administration.

invoice.description: Fingerprint of the invoice related to the proforma invoice or credit note, if any

proforma.description: Fingerprint of the proforma invoice related to the invoice, if any

creditNotes.description: Fingerprints of the credit notes related to the invoice, if any

Invoice.description: Document representing an invoice at any stage.

verified.description: True if the ownership of the bank account has been verified

consentExpiresAt.description: Date and time of the bank account PSD2 consent expiration

sanctioned.description: True if the company is present in the list of sanctioned subjects

verified.description: True if the company information has been verified

accounts.description: List of bank accounts of the company

birthDate.description: Date of birth of the consumer

birthPlace.description: Place of birth of the consumer

birthCountry.description: Country of birth of the consumer

sanctioned.description: True if the consumer is present in the list of sanctioned subjects

verified.description: True if the consumer information has been verified

accounts.description: List of bank accounts of the consumer

id.description: Unique identifier of the KYC session

createdAt.description: Date and time of the KYC session creation

updatedAt.description: Date and time of the last KYC session update

lastAccessAt.description: Date and time of the last KYC session access

canLogin.description: True if the user can login to the KYC session. If true, the user can retrieve data verified in previous sessions and can skip some steps of the KYC flow.

description.example: Electronic invoice signed with P7M format

DocumentItem.description: Billing item. This is used only for UX and utility purposes and will not be used for the payment process.

DocumentTerm.description: A payment term of the document, it will be used to generate the payment schedule.

currency.description:
Currency of the payment.
Note: All payments must be in the same currency.

description.description: Description of the payment. This will be shown to the customer when paying the invoice through the FlowPay checkout page.

remittance.description:
Remittance information. This will be shown to the customer during the payment process and will be included in the bank statement.
Notes: - This field is optional and will be automatically generated if not provided with the format: Invoice # - - Remittance will also contain a FlowPay identifier
remittance.example: Invoice #1234 - subscription to the premium plan

id.description: Unique identifier of the payment assigned by FlowPay.

sessionID.description: Unique identifier of the checkout session

createdAt.description: Date and time of the payment creation

updatedAt.description: Date and time of the last payment update

PaymentStatusEnum.description:
Status of the payment.
- `authorized`: payment authorized by the user
- `arrived_to_technical_account`: payment arrived to the FlowPay technical account. t
- `outgoing_from_technical_account`: payment outgoing from the technical account
- `completed`: funds has been transferred to the beneficiary
- `rejected`: payment rejected by the bank
- `revoked`: payment revoked by the user or by the client in case of conditional payment

RequestID.description:
Unique identifier of the request.
It is helpful to identify the request in case of errors, providing it to the support team. Please submit it in the support ticket.

createdAt.description: Date and time of the quote creation

fingerprint.description: Fingerprint of the document accounting for the quote

files.description: List of files related to the quote

SiteWorkerContractCreation.description: Request to create a new contract between a construction site and a worker

createdAt.description: Date and time of the contract creation

SiteWorkerContract.description: Contract between a company and a worker for a construction site

createdAt.description: Date and time of the contract creation

id.description: Unique identifier of the transaction assigned by FlowPay. This is not end to end transaction identifier, which is not provided by banks via Open Banking APIs.

debtorIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number of the debtor

creditorIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number of the creditor

Transfer.description:
Kind of document that allow clients to manage payment requests with low constraints.
Clients can use transfers to fast prototyping payment initiation use cases or to avoid specific document's lifecycle managment.
Note: In order to use transfers in production, a more in-depth due diligence is required.

createdAt.description: Date and time of the transfer creation

message.example: Proforma invoice can not have a due date later than the invoice date

path.description: JSON path of the field that caused the error

key.description: JSON key of the field that caused the error

type.description: Expected type of the field that caused the error

Unauthorized.description: Client has not provided valid credentials to access the requested resource

message.example: You must provide a valid access token

Forbidden.description: Client is not authorized to access the requested resource

message.example: You can't create a new invoice for this tenant

NotFound.description: The requested resource was not found

Conflict.description: The requested resource is in conflict with the current state of the server

InternalServerError.description: Server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

post.description: Notify the status of the account information service (AIS)

status.description:
Status of the account information service (AIS) consent granted by account owner to FlowPay.
- `ACTIVATED`: consent granted by account owner
- `REVOKED`: consent revoked by account owner
- `EXPIRED`: consent expired

rejectionReason.description:
Reason of the rejection of the consent. It is present only if the status is `REVOKED`.
Note: The majority of the banks do not provide this information. Consent may be revoked from the bank for any reason or by the user from the bank website.
rejectionReason.example: Operation not allowed on ASPSP system

tags.name: Checkout
tags.description: This endpoint allows managing checkout sessions any document client has access to

tags.name: Construction
tags.description: Manage construction sites and related entities lifecycle

tags.name: Payments
tags.description: Access to payments initiated by FlowPay

tags.name: Transactions
tags.description: Endpoint for retrieving transactions collected with AIS consent

post.summary: Get an access token or refresh an existing one
post.description: Get an access token or refresh an existing one

access_token.description: Access token to be used to access protected resources

expires_in.description: Number of seconds before the access token expires

refresh_token.description: Refresh token to be used to obtain a new access token

scope.description: List of scopes granted to the client, separated by a space

active.description: Whether the token is active or not

client_id.description: Client identifier of the application that obtained the token

clientID.description: Client identifier of the application that obtained the token

expiresAt.description: Date and time when the token expires

exp.description: The unix timestamp indicating when this token will expire.

consumer.description: Consumer identifier that granted the token

companies.description: List of companies for which consumer has access to

get.description: Get the list of accounts associated to the token

parameters.name: tenantID
parameters.description:
Tenant identifier to filter accounts.
This has effect only for token obtained with client_credentials grant type which could be associated to multiple tenants.
If not specified, response will contain all accounts associated to all tenants the token is authorized to access

200.description: List of accounts. TODO: La paginazione non serve qui,  per prototipo

post.description:
Create a new session to allow an user to grant consent to FlowPay to access his accounts for AIS service.
Clients can use this endpoint to create a new session to allow an user to grant consent to FlowPay to access his accounts for AIS service.

tenantID.description: Tenant identifier of user who will grant consent to FlowPay to access his accounts for AIS service

bank.description: Bank identifier. If not specified, the user will be able to choose the bank from a list of supported banks

link.description: URL to be used to redirect the user to the bank website to grant consent to FlowPay to access his accounts for AIS service

get.description:
Redirect URL to be used by FlowPay to notify the client that user has granted consent to FlowPay to access his accounts for AIS service.
After the user has granted consent to FlowPay to access his accounts for AIS service, the bank will redirect to FlowPay server to notify the result of the operation, FlowPay will then redirect to the client to notify the result of the operation.
Use this redirect URL to manage user experience, for example, you can synchronously refresh token at backend and redirect the user to a specific page in your client application.
Note: You can be notified of the result of the operation also by using the webhook mechanism.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Identifier of the user who has granted consent.

get.description:
Redirect URL to be used by FlowPay to notify the client that user has not granted consent to FlowPay to access his accounts for AIS service.
After user redirection to FlowPay server, FlowPay will then redirect to the client to notify the result of the operation.
Use this redirect URL to manage user experience.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Identifier of the user who has not granted consent.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Reason why user has not granted consent. Note: This parameter is optional and it is not supported by all banks. User may voluntarily not grant consent or he may have not been able to grant consent due to some bank error.

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific account
Retrieve the list of banks supported by FlowPay

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) to filter banks by country

parameters.name: recurring
parameters.description: Filter banks by support at least one recurring payment type

parameters.name: recurringFrequency
parameters.description: Filter banks by support specified recurring payment frequency

parameters.name: sctType
parameters.description: Filter banks by support specified SCT type

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific bank

post.description:
Create a new bulk document. This endpoint allows to specificy a dictionary of fingerprints to be linked to the bulk payment, each property name is the document type.
Returns the bulk document created with a new fingerprint.

requestBody.description: Preferences and fingerprints that will be part of the bulk payment.

allowWireTranfersAggregation.description: If true, wire transfers to the same beneficiary will be aggregated, this determines a saving. If false, wire transfer to the same beneficiary will not be aggregated, this allows beneficiary to have a more detailed view of the payments and keeps the payment remittance information.

documents.description: Dictionary of fingerprints to be linked to the bulk payment, each property name is the document type.

additionalProperties.description: List of fingerprints to be linked to the bulk payment. Property name is the document type.

get.description:
List all bulk documents according to the specified filters.
Returns a paginated list of bulk documents.
Get bulk document details by ID

delete.description:
Delete bulk payment by ID.
Deleting a bulk payment will not delete the linked documents.

post.description: Create a new chain document. This endpoint allows to specify the fingerprint of the document that will be paid and the trigger document for that payment, along with their type.

requestBody.description: Dictionary of fingerprints to be linked to the bulk payment, each property name is the document type.

get.description:
List all chain documents according to the specified filters.
Returns a paginated list of chain documents.
Get bulk document details by ID

post.description:
This endpoint allows to create a new checkout specifying the document to be paid.
If the payment needs to be authorized by the user, the response will contain a link to be used to redirect the user to FlowPay payment page.

locked.description:
If true funds will be directed to FlowPay technical account and will not be available to the beneficiary until the payment is confirmed or revoked via API.
See locked payments paragraph for more details.

scaExempt.description:
If true, the payment will be exempted from SCA.
Only some use cases are eligible for SCA exemption, see SCA exemption paragraph for more details.
In case of SCA exemption, if a supported payment method is specified, the payment will be instantly processed.

okRedirectUrl.description:
URL to be used to redirect the user to the client application after the payment has been successfully processed.
If not specified, the user will be redirected to the default FlowPay payment page.

koRedirectUrl.description:
URL to be used to redirect the user to the client application in case of payment failure.
If not specified, the user will be redirected to the default FlowPay payment page.

preferences.description: Useful to customize payer user experience on payment page

paymentMethod.description:
Payer payment method to be used to pay the document.
If not specified, the user will be able to choose the payment method from a list of supported payment methods.

canEditRemittance.description: If true, the user will be able to edit the remittance information from the payment page.

allowedMethods.description:
List of allowed payment methods.
If not specified, all supported payment methods will be allowed.

200.description:
Payment processed.
This response is returned only if the payment has been processed without requiring user authorization, i.e. in the case of a checkout created with SCA exemption (`scaExempt`) and consistent payment method (`preferences.paymentMethod`)

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific checkout

delete.description:
Allows to delete a checkout.
This endpoint can be used to delete a checkout that has not been paid yet.
If the checkout has been paid, it cannot be deleted and this endpoint will return an error.

post.description: Create a credit note to be paid by a customer

invoice.description: Invoice to which this credit note refers to.

amount.description: Credit note amount. Amount must be equal or less than the invoice amount. If the credit note amount is less than the invoice amount, the remaining amount will be payable by the customer. Multiple credit notes can be created for the same invoice and the total amount of all credit notes must be equal or less than the invoice amount.

get.description: Retrieve a list of credit notes
Retrieve a credit note details by its fingerprint

delete.description: Delete a credit note by its fingerprint

post.description: This endpoint manages the association between a site and a worker. Is not mandatory for the worker to be registered on FlowPay. This request must be authorized by the site owner, then the worker will be able to call the [PATCH] `/constructions/contracts/{identifier}` endpoint to complete the handshake.

attachments.description: List of files FlowPay will use to verify worker

items.description: Identifier of the file uploaded to FlowPay using the `/files` endpoint

get.description: Allows to retrieve a list of workers associated to the customer.

patch.description: This endpoint allows workers to accept the assignment to a site. The request must be authorized by the worker.

delete.description: This endpoint allows workers and site owners to withdraw from a contract. The request must be authorized by the worker or the site owner.

post.description: Allows to define a new site to be managed with FlowPay

requestBody.description: Information needed to create and verify a new site

name.description: User friendly name to identify the site
name.example: Cantiere di via Roma famiglia Verdi

description.description: Information about the site and planned activities. Details are not mandatory but an exhaustive description is recommended to help during the verification process and to avoid delays or more information requests.
description.example: Lavori di ristrutturazione completa dell'immobile, comprensivi di rifacimento tetti, creazione di un ulteriore vano e lavori al giardino

address.description: Address of the site in free format

expectedEndDate.description: Estimated end date of the site

attachments.description: List of files FlowPay will use to verify site operations

items.description: Identifier of the file uploaded to FlowPay using the `/files` endpoint

get.description: Allows to retrieve a list of sites managed by the customer
Allows to retrieve details of a specific site

post.description:
Allows to cashout residual money from a site.
The request acts on the site wallet owned by the owner of the oauth token used to call the endpoint.

amount.description: Amount to be cashed out, this amount will be used to generate a document to be paid in order to transfer the amount from the wallet to the owner bank account.

account.description: Identifier of the bank account to be used to transfer the amount. If not specified, the default bank account will be used.

description.description: Remittance information to be used to generate the document. Details are not mandatory but an exhaustive description is recommended to help during the verification process and to avoid delays or more information requests.
description.example: Pagamento stipendio dipendenti, pagamento fornitore XYZ

post.description:
Allows to create a new quote for a specific site, useful to credit site owner wallet with the amount needed to start the site operations.
The request must be authorized by the site owner.

amount.description: Estimated amount for the site. If the token has `wallet:construction` scope, this amount will be used to generate a document to be paid in order to transfer initial amount to the wallet.

expectedEndDate.description: Estimated end date of the site

description.description: Information about the site and planned activities. Details are not mandatory but an exhaustive description is recommended to help during the verification process and to avoid delays or more information requests.
description.example: Giardino posteriore: rifacimento pavimentazione, installazione impianto di irrigazione, installazione impianto di illuminazione

attachments.description: List of files FlowPay will use to verify site operations

items.description: Identifier of the file uploaded to FlowPay using the `/files` endpoint

get.description: Allows to retrieve a list of quotes for a specific site

post.description:
You can register work progress by passing a list of the invoices previously uploaded using the `/invoices` endpoint.
The request must be authorized by the worker.
Each invoice between site owner and worker will be linked to a new site-related document, if there are multiple such invoices, a single document with multiple terms will be created.
Each invoice between the worker and their suppliers will be linked to a new document, if there are multiple invoices for the same supplier, a single document with multiple terms will be created.
Note: The sum of the worker-to-customer invoices must be at least equal to the sum of the supplier-to-worker invoices

get.description: Allows to retrieve a list of work progress registered by the worker
Allows to retrieve details of a specific work progress
Retrieve the list of fees applied to the customer for the services provided by the client

post.description: Create an invoice to be paid by a customer

creditor.description: Creditor VAT number, must be a company

debtor.description: Debtor VAT number, could be a company or a person

terms.description: Payment terms used to generate payment requests

schema.description: Italian FatturaPA XML file encoded in base64. Both plain text invoice and .p7m signed invoice are supported.

get.description: Retrieve invoices list according to the specified filters

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date of the invoices to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is the first day of the current month

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date of the invoices to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is the current date

get.description: Retrieve invoice details by fingerprint

post.description: Start KYC process for the current user

redirectURL.description: URL where the user will be redirected after the KYC process is completed. If not specified, user will be redirected to the `/kyc/:identifier` endpoint wich will return the KYC data in JSON format.

canLogin.description: If true, the user will be able to login using one of the supported identity providers and other information that FlowPay has about the user will be used to pre-fill the KYC data. If false, the user must provide all the required information even if FlowPay already has it.

flow.description: Flow to be used for the KYC process. If not specified, user will be able to choose the flow.

consumer.description: Consumer data to be used to pre-fill the KYC

iban.description: Consumer IBAN. If provided, FlowPay will use it to pre-validate ownership of the account, if autonomous IBAN check is not possibile, the IBAN will be used to find the bank where the account is held and the user will be asked to perform a Strong Customer Authentication with the bank.

bank.description:
FlowPay identifier of the bank where the consumer holds the account. If provided, FlowPay will use it suggest the bank to the user during the Strong Customer Authentication process.
The identifier can be retrieved using the `/banks` endpoint.

company.description: Company data to be used to pre-fill the KYC

iban.description: Company IBAN. If provided, FlowPay will use it to pre-validate ownership of the account, if autonomous IBAN check is not possibile, the IBAN will be used to find the bank where the account is held and the user will be asked to perform a Strong Customer Authentication with the bank.

bank.description:
FlowPay identifier of the bank where the company holds the account. If provided, FlowPay will use it suggest the bank to the user during the Strong Customer Authentication process.
The identifier can be retrieved using the `/banks` endpoint.

get.description: Retrieve KYC data for the specified session

post.description: Allow to upload a pagoPA payment notice

paVatCode.description: VAT code of the public administration

get.description: Retrieve pagoPA list according to the specified filters

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date of the pagoPA list to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is the first day of the current month

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date of the pagoPA list to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is the current date

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the pagoPA list to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is 'all'

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the pagoPA list to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is 1

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size of the pagoPA list to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is 10

get.description: Retrieve pagoPA details by fingerprint
Retrieve pagoPA receipt by fingerprint
Retrieve payments made through FlowPay

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date of the payments to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is the first day of the current month

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date of the payments to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is the last day of the current month

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific payment

post.description: Create a proforma invoice to be paid by a customer

number.description: Proforma number. This field is optional, if not provided, FlowPay will generate a unique uuid

invoice.description: Invoice fingerprint to which the proforma invoice is related. Note that the invoice must be in a state that allows the creation of a proforma invoice (e.g. not already paid). If the invoice already has a proforma invoice, the request will fail

creditor.description: Creditor VAT number, must be a company

debtor.description: Debtor VAT number, could be a company or a person

terms.description: Payment terms used to generate payment requests

409.description: Proforma invoice already exists for invoice

message.example: Proforma invoice already exists for invoice 123456

get.description: Retrieve proforma invoices list according to the specified filters

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date of the proforma invoices to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is the first day of the current month

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date of the proforma invoices to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is the last day of the current month

get.description: Retrieve a proforma invoice details

delete.description: Delete a proforma invoice. This operation is allowed only if the proforma invoice is not yet paid

get.description: Retrieve transactions of a specific account

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency of the transactions to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is EUR

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date of the period to retrieve transactions for. If not specified, the default value is the first day of the current month

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date of the period to retrieve transactions for. If not specified, the default value is the current date

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is 1

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of transactions to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is 10

get.description:
Retrieve details of a specific transaction.
If the transactions has been originated by a payment authorized using FlowPay, the payment details are included in the response, but only if the token used to call the API has the `payment:read` scope.

allOf.description:
If the transactions has been originated by a payment authorized using FlowPay, the payment details are included in the response.
This field is present only if the token used to call the API has the `payment:read` scope.

get.description: Retrieve transfers document list

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date of the period to retrieve transfers for. If not specified, the default value is the first day of the current month

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date of the period to retrieve transfers for. If not specified, the default value is the current date

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is 1

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of transfers to retrieve. If not specified, the default value is 10

remittance.description: Remittance information of the SEPA Credit Transfer
remittance.example: Pizza at Pizzeria da Mario. Thank you!

get.description: Retrieve transfer document details

delete.description: Delete a transfer document that has not yet been executed
